Fields.DialogueText: Oi, what ya doin' over there, mateys?! Hm... No... Nein! Change ze program to five! Ready ze missiles!
... what are you doing?
Mate-- ah, Captain. Thanks to my recent reformation, I was... practicing.
Reformation? Ark, what are you talking about?
I have heard when a person changes, they take an entirely new identity. Right now, I am amid this transformation.
People don't take on different accents, though...
Life has infinite possibilities. Who is to say I cannot take on a new accent? Or even a new mother tongue?

Fields.MenuText: Society wouldn't approve...
What if I forbid it?
You could insult other nations by mimicking their accents.

Fields.DialogueText: I am a manifested ship fighting phantom ships in a war that makes no sense. Must I abide by the rules of logic, Captain?
Knowing you, Captain, I doubt you would forbid me to have my way.  Given all that we have seen together...
I do not find it insulting. It is not like I spat on their leaders...
People can go Knickerbocker glory over what I do and I still will not care. As long as I keep my sense of purpose, I will be fine.
Ark, that pun was pushing it...
We've got Morganas to port--
@BATTLE
Ah... tea time has arrived, yet already Morganas ruin my delightful view? How troublesome.
@BATTLE
Captain! I have speculaas news to report!
Oh? What happened?
Do you remember the recipes I took back from you? I sent them to a publisher when we made landfall.
I'm tying myself into a pretzel with worry, but...
That's amazing, Ark!
And! They said they'd send me word as soon as possible!
Do publishing houses normally respond that fast?
No, but they made a special exception for me, for I am a proper Lady. A publisher would be absolutely tipsy laird to get their hands upon a Belle's written work!

Fields.MenuText: Somehow, I think you're making up puns nowadays...
Can I get a copy when it's published?
I hate to ask but... "tipsy laird"?

Fields.DialogueText: Why does it matter? I am enjoying myself, no?
Of course! It would be a tragedy to deny you such precious work.
Like a trifle, but spiked with whiskey.
Hm. While I wait, I will look through the rest of the remaining recipes that did not pass muster. Would you care to join me, Captain?
But--
Please, Captain. Do not be a spotted di--
All right, all right, no need for coarse language! Of course I'll join you.
Uh, Ark?
Morganas...
@BATTLE
Yes, that is all. Thank you - and your team - for your daily inspections, sailor.
Our pleasure, Lady.
Why the long face?
How in the heavens could my recipes be rejected!?
Pardon?
The publishing house, Captain! They rejected each and every one of my recipes!  I cannot even bring myself to make a pun!
That might have been for the be– Ah, don't give me that look!
Hah... Apologies, Captain. I want... my legacy to live on. But if no one wants me to be remembered...
I'm sure that's not what they meant, Ark...
What do you think I should do, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: If you want to be remembered, maybe you should try something else. You could always go for gold at the Olympics. Or start some sort of competition. A bake-off?
Can't you find a different publisher?
I honestly don't know. Maybe we should make a plan of attack together.

Fields.DialogueText: Your flattery is pleasant, but do remind yourself I cannot stray far from the ship. Thank you so much for reminding me of events I cannot participate in.
That is not possible, Captain. With the war on, and rationing what it is, no one wants to publish a cookbook right now. That publisher was my only chance.
Hm... If you do not know, it probably is up to me to figure this out.
Sorry, Captain. I need to figure this out on my own.
Ark.
... Do not trouble yourself. I know if I need help, you'll always be here for me.
Thank you, Ark.
I should be saying that, you goose!
Hm, what do you think, Captain?
Huh? Is that a circle and a stick?
Not just any circle and stick, Captain - a hoop and a stick!
Why on earth do you have this?
One of the crew members kindly purchased it for me. I've got a plan, you see.
And what would that be?
I'll send this to a very beautiful and elegant Lord back home who wants to correspond with a ship's Lady.
I'm not sure an elegant Lord would have time to play children's games...
That is precisely why I am sending these objects to him. Pay attention, Captain! What if he needs to reconnect with his past?
Might be a stretch there, Royal.
Perhaps, but I have to try. Oh! Here's the courier now.
He will understand what I mean. My utter sincere gratitude.
Yes, Lady...

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure this is wise?
You're not going to regret doing this?
What if he sees this as something more than a friendly gesture?

Fields.DialogueText: What is he going to do, Captain? Come attack me with a fleet because I send him a harmless hoop and stick? His Grace does not strike me as that type of person.
No, Captain. If life has no guarantees, then we should at least attempt this gesture. There's no telling what might happen next.
Then he will have to endure my puns and baking much more frequently!
Why do I have a bad feeling about this?
Because Morganas are behind us...
@BATTLE
Here you go, Captain. Please make sure to tell his Grace that this is a sign of my rock cake hard love.
Captain! Permission to requisition items--
Why so formal?
Because I feel like I can't ask for this without mincing my words.
Out with it, Ark.
I request over 1,000 sheets of traditional paper without any lines or blemishes. Oh, and additional paper to make envelopes, stamps, ink, quills...
Hang on, hang on - that's a big request. What're you trying to do?
... It is a secret for now, Captain. Will you trust me?

Fields.MenuText: ... But what are you going to do with so much paper?
I smell something fishy.
This isn't a prank, is it? You're not getting ready to spring a pun on me?

Fields.DialogueText: I already told you, Captain - it's a secret.
What you smell is the sweet scent of victory.
Quite the contrary, Captain. My puns will continue till morale improves- with or without the supplies.
All right, fine. I'll have to reach into my own pockets for this...
Oh, thank heavens! You have sent this young Lady over the moonpie--
...Not for long.
@BATTLE
On my signal, men! 1, 2, 3! Go!
Haaaaaugh!...
Aaaand, time! Not bad. 124 seconds from the front to the back of the ship. I'm... impressed.
Thank you, Lady!
We are not done yet, men! Please strengthen your legs with some stretches; the Captain arrives.
Ark, do you have a– what is going on here?!
Endurance training, Captain. Do you expect them to be unfit for this war?
Well, no, but–
Then please understand- we are doing what is best for the crew, for the fleet, and for all of humanity.
Ark, I hate to break this fantasy you have, but– don't give me that look! ...Ugh... Fine. But give them plenty of rest, all right?
I am a harsh Lady, but not a cruel one. Do not doubt me.

Fields.MenuText: I was not trying to.
Of course I don't doubt you! But sometimes every leader needs a reminder to look out for their crew.
No one said you were harsh, Ark.

Fields.DialogueText: Good, because I am far from being a brandy snappish type of person.
I see your point. It just caught me by surprise, Captain.
Maybe, but it seemed like you were implying it. I am not a Lady that came out of the fly's graveyard.
All right men, break is over! Give me fifty press-ups, on the double.
Wait, I thought they were stretching their legs?
Captain, I cannot lift everything off the shelves. They have to maintain their upper body strength to help me bake at full capacity.
Can they use their upper body strength to help chase away these Morganas?
@BATTLE
Hm... Lila Bor– Oh, heavens! Did she have to disrupt me now, of all times!
Lila... Borges? That doesn't sound like your fancy Lord...
@BATTLE
Ark? Ark! Where is that girl?
In here, Captain.
Oh there you are, I was wondering-- Are you building a paper fortress?
Careful!
Why do you have papers scattered from here to everywhere?
Because I am writing.
More recipes?
No, Captain. I am writing letters to over a thousand people.
What on earth? Why?
... If I cannot be seen by a publishing house, then I will have to rely on over a thousand random strangers to remember me.
Where did you get these names and addresses?
Since I am trying to communicate with people and not lock myself away in the control room, I told the crew my plight.
Anyway, they gave me the addresses of people they know, and friends of friends, and one gave me a pamphlet that listed the addresses of people around the world!
...This is a travel brochure, Ark.
At any rate, I want to try one more time with these thousand people... One of these souls must want to keep my legacy alive.

Fields.MenuText: They will, Ark.
Why isn't my memory enough for you?
Do you need help writing these letters?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for having hope, Captain.
It is, Captain, but I want to let others know of the existence of my work and who I am. ...Or was.
Kind of you to offer, Captain, but I want to make these personal. I may not know these people, but I want them to feel like I'm speaking to them, and them alone.
Sorry, Captain, but can you excuse me? I have a baker's dozen to finish before the next Morganas arrive.
Just don't hurt your hands...
I'll explain later, Captain.
We're under attack! There's so many Morganas--
...I might have put a little too much lemon in this tea.
Get ready for another hit! Augh!
Ark! We need you on– This is not the time to be having tea and biscuits! Especially on deck! Whoa, cannon fire, incoming!
Oh, hello, Captain. Fine weather we are having today.
That is the least of my concerns right now, Ark! Can you not hear the Morganas?!
Hmm... I do not know how to describe it but... I found a sense of tranquility, and walled off the sounds that are unnecessary to maintain a state of bliss.
Ark, what are you trying to say!?
What I mean is, the tea ceremony helps maintain inner peace within the moment, allowing yourself to have clear thoughts.

Fields.MenuText: Please put away the tea and focus.
Get yourself together, Ark!
... What kind of tea is that, anyway?

Fields.DialogueText: What if sitting down with me will allow you to understand me just a little more?
Are you not curious how to achieve this sense of tranquility, Captain?
Ah, good question, Captain. I was thinking it was Earl Grey with lemon, but I'm not entirely sure...
Heeeelp!... Now.
Ah... Perhaps too strong to my liking, but delightful tea all the same. Would you care to join me the next time we have a Morgana inducing chaos on board?
Uh... sure. If I die because of this, I blame you, Ark.
Heh, you know you carrot cake for me a lot, Captain.
@BATTLE
Ack! Come on, legs, cooperate...
What's wrong?
Sometimes my legs are worn out when I run for excessive periods of time, Captain.
Have you been eating and stretching properly?
I have, Captain. It always has been like this. All I need to do is rub my legs like so... Hm... Ow, I did that a little too tight. Ah... there we are.

Fields.MenuText: Please don't ask me to massage you.
Do you need help?
Do other parts of your body ache like this?

Fields.DialogueText: As my best friend, that would be a bit awkward, no?
Ah, thank you for the offer, but all I do is light massages to put myself back into top shape.
Hm, sometimes my back, but that is mostly my own doing. You see, I slouch when no one is looking. That might be considered rude, but one can't stay proper at all times.
Enough of that now! 500 squats! Go!
Do you expect these legs to run themselves? 1... Ugh... 2... and... Morganas...
Hey, run to the deck, Ark! That'll be enough exercise, won't it?
But my squats...
@BATTLE
Lady Ark Royal! I received quite a few letters for you from port.
Oh, my! There are so many. Thank you, kind sir.
I guess you aren't going to be forgotten any time soon, huh?
Indeed... Oh, blast!
Let's read some of the letters after we get back, shall we?
Yes, sir!
@BATTLE
Ah, I remember this name. Lila Borges, right? That was the one that came from Brazil.
Yes, one of the men in the boiler room gave me this address. Let us read it together, shall we?
"Dear Miss Ark Royal, Thank you kindly for sending these recipes to me. When I tried them out they weren't that impressive. Signed, Lila Borges."
Um, Ark?

Fields.MenuText: Are you all right?
Don't take it too bad, she probably doesn't know what she is saying.
Maybe she got the recipe confused somehow.

Fields.DialogueText: Huh?
What are you talking about, sir?
Hmm...
I'm fine, sir. It just caught me on the back foot.
You sure?
Yes! Look, sir! This letter came all the way from Sweden from a person named Joel!
He loved the pancake recipes I provided him. Even included a photo of his family enjoying the meal!
Make sure to write him a thank you letter. I'll see you in a little bit, Ark.
Take care, sir.
Amazing! Look, Captain! Some of these letters came from as far away as Brazil.
INSOLENCE!
Hm, I could go for some-waugh! Ark!?
That insolent little prat... wasn't impressed with my cooking...
...I have a feeling I heard this language from someone else before...
Hrngh... More flour and less baking soda perhaps...
Uh, Ark?
Up the temperature by about... 5 Celsius should do it... then rotate the cake 180 degrees halfway through the baking time....

Fields.MenuText: Ark Royal?... Lady Ark Royal?
What are you up to?
Making a new recipe?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... Hello, Captain. I'm busy at the moment proving that Lila Borges wrong! My cakes are absolutely delicious and impressionable!
Making Lila Borges eat her words!
Revising the old one to make it worthy of a queen!
You get her, Ark!
... If Morganas don't interfere every blasted second I try to bake.
Hah, I guess I have to clean up her mess. Or... eton mess.
Not you too!
@BATTLE
Captain! Please come with me for a little bit. Down these stairs and to the left... ah, here we are.
Hm? What's wrong, Ark?
Ah, nothing is the matter, Captain. I just thought we could try... this!
Hm? Isn't that green tea powder?
Hah... hi. I think that is how the Japanese say it... Anyway, one of the Japanese crew members from another ship sent me a sample of their finest matcha!
So you want to try it out?
Yes, Captain. It would be deadly dull to try it by myself, though... so you must try it with me!

Fields.MenuText: Want to make a bet? Whoever cringes at the taste of this tea runs 100 laps around the ship.
Hm, I wonder what this tea tastes like. I can't remember if I had this tea or not.
It's really green!

Fields.DialogueText: As a proper Lady, I don't gamble... if I don't know I'll win.
I do not know either. The Japanese man whom I got this from only describes it as a "grassy" tea.
Mhm, the Japanese man told me it is ground from... "guy-yo-koro" leaves.
Uh, Ark? Your face stopped moving.
Eee... Really bitter, Captain!...
Good thing I taught the Japanese man some of my best puns, so in a way I already got my revenge. Perhaps he was mad before the events of the Zurich Agreement...
I'm quite sure he was just trying to be friendly, Ark...
I know, I know, but just in case!
@BATTLE
I hope the poor dears did not give me all of their reserved tea...
Would the bedfordshire clangers tolerate this? No! Men, forward, and let them taste our Blackburns!
@BATTLE
Ahem, hello, everyone. This is Ark Royal speaking. I would like to inform you that in the galley, we have a variety of cakes and pastries for you to try out.
Please let the chef know what you think of each dessert. Thank you.
Ahem...
Oh, hello, Captain, I did not see you there! Gave me quite a startle...
Can you reserve the intercom for emergencies, please?
But this was important, Captain! My latest recipe is pielicious and must be tried... along with the ice cream recipes I sent to Lila.
I intend to impress her!
So that's why you locked yourself in the kitchen this morning...
Yes! And why I abused the ship's intercoms.

Fields.MenuText: Can you inform me next time before you pull something like this?
Do you think you did better this time?
What type of ice cream did you make this time?

Fields.DialogueText: I will try to, but you will have to give me a date--
Of course I did, Captain! It was a piece of short--
Ah, I made strawberry ice cream! A classic for many people, it is a cobb--
Ark, no!
But the puns cannot be stopped!
...Even if I try to stop you, they will still happen, won't they?
You know me too well, Captain. Like bread and butter pudding.
Heh...
Hmm, hmm hmm, hm-hm!
You seem awfully cheerful right now, when we have Morganas approaching.
Ah, that is because I have sent the new recipes to Lila Borges. No doubt she'll love them!
The whole crew unanimously agreed it tasted rhubarbly.
Even you have to admit that made no sense.
In my world it did.
@BATTLE
Insolence!
Wha!?
Ark, come here!... Don't shout like that in front of the crew. What's wrong?
Hah... apologies, Captain. I got a reply back from Lila Borges. According to her the ice cream is "too sweet" and the apple pie is too "bready."
I will have you know, I let Leonardo- you know him? The strong midshipman?- taste the apple pie. He burst into tears because of how good it was!
"Too bready", my rye...

Fields.MenuText: Do you think the crew lied about how it tasted?
I'm starting to think she's lying to you.
Leonardo is kind of a soft guy in the center...

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not! I have earned their respect. They would have no reason to lie to me.
That would be preposterous! Why would she lie?
He is, but he's an honest soul, Captain.
I will write to her and ask what she is thinking. How dare she send me such- such insolence!
Don't be too harsh, Ark.
*ALARM*
"Why... do... you... hate... my recipes?" Hm... I guess now there is no denying it now. I have officially acknowledged her lack of respect!
How's the letter going?
Coming along. Tomorrow I'll have this sent to this... Lila Borges.
Your arch-nemesis. How do you get these letters out so fast?
Ah... that's a secret.
Can't you trust me, Ark?
We Ladies have a secret communications network. Our Friends send our letters quickly and with the utmost discretion.
It would be troublesome if letters were received to someone who had no idea what a Lady is. And anyway, this is more efficient than other carriers.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like an underground organization.
Why not tell our superiors about this, Ark? It could be useful to the war effort.
Hm, sounds interesting.

Fields.DialogueText: Something like that, Captain. But we don't intend to smuggle or to overthrow a government. We're well within the letter of the Zurich Agreement.
If the other superiors knew, do you know how many requests we would get? There would be almost no way of communicating with other Ladies.
It very much is!
Would you like to be a secret messenger too?
I'll think about it. ... Look sharp, Morganas approaching!
Of all the things...
@BATTLE
Hmm...
Ark?
Hah... mustn't loaf, we've got Morganas coming.
Glad you can still pun at a time like this.
@BATTLE
What were you going to say, Ark?
I got another letter from Lila...
You seem a lot less angry about it.
No use crying over spilled milk, Captain.
Sounds like a very critical person.
I'd bet the King's Corgis on that. Why can this woman not accept that this is her fault?! She refuses to read properly, that's all!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the recipe is actually written in an odd manner?
...Corgis?
Read it again. I think you'll find something you didn't see before.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt it. I wrote it as clearly as possible and revised a hundred times.
The royal family in Great Britain prize their Corgis.
Hah... very well, I can't deny your advice is actually reasonable. Unlike a certain Miss Borges.
I will return to the kitchen and figure this out, Captain. Please excuse me.
Call me if you need me to taste-test, all right?
Of course.
Anyway, she says she hates my recipes because they are confusing to follow. She makes a lot of mistakes. And even if she understood, the measurements are difficult.
Captain, please move that table near that crate. Right around... there. Perfect. Like a spot in the royal garden!
Why are we out here with a table?
Because we are preparing. Grab the other corners of the tablecloth? Thank you. I'll place the plates here and set the tea warmer there... Just a little further... and fantastic! We are set.
I'm getting the strangest sense of deja vu.
No more talking, please. Take a sip of that tea and tell me... what kind is it? Ahh...
Hm... I think it is a ch-- Holy mother of god, there's a Morgana!
Shh, Captain. Silence. Focus on the tea, not the cannon fire.
But we're--
The sooner you cooperate, the sooner you can help.
AAAAAAAHHHH!
What kind of tea is it, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: It's a chai, isn't it?
Is it... Earl Gray?
... Hibiscus tea?

Fields.DialogueText: Correct! Notice the hints of cinnamon and cardamom? Delightful combination.
While I did enjoy that Earl Gray before, it is a chai, Captain. I do not think you've experienced this before.
Ah, you do not know your tea, Captain. Can you feel the milkiness of the tea? The spices? That is chai.
Do you see now? How things have slowed down, even with all the carnage around us? We can see things we did not see before.
This... is truly bizarre, Ark...
Yes, I only discovered this recently. The Japanese soldier gave me advice on meditation and I devised a strategy that  only a true British Lady can do. Tea amongst the chaos.
That was fun, Captain. Let us help our crew, shall we?
I don't know what to say anymore...
@BATTLE
Hah... More Morganas. I wonder how the Lord is doing today? I hope he's enjoying his tea.
@BATTLE
Make sure you get these to the Englishman, all right? Code Lamb, then.
Yes, Lady!
Hm? More of the Belle messaging system, Ark?
Don't speak so loudly, Captain! This time I sent the Englishman a few volumes of Shakespeare. Leather-bound, the works.
Perhaps he'll like this better than the hoop and stick? Either way, this will remind him we are still communicating.
You think he would forget you like that?
Not intentionally, Captain. Battles, love, alcohol, worries, can make us forget our friends. And that's without a war on.
Ark...
Ah, do not look like that, Captain. I am just happy he did not send a message telling me to never contact him again. Leroy told me he received my package, so....

Fields.MenuText: What do you hope will happen between you two?
Who's Leroy?
Can you imagine the Englishman with a hoop and stick anyway?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm, I want to get to know him, and perhaps... perhaps...
Leroy is one of the leaders of the human faction of the Lady messaging system.
Hehe, I cannot, but I do hope he has fun with it.
Ark?
Haha... nothing, Captain. I have some more experimenting to do with the recipes anyway. Please excuse me.
War tries its best to dehumanize us. Down to the very fiber of our being. And that makes us forgetful.
All right, chef. How many cups do we need?
Hm. No more than three - otherwise it'll just melt into a goop.
Ah, but I want to make this fluffier and sweeter.
Ark, are you in here? We got–
What if we made two separate batches? One with the excess cups, and the other based on your revisions, chef?
Hmm... Consider it done!
Are you listening?
Now... how thin should I roll the crust...

Fields.MenuText: Hello?...
Aaaark?
... Baaark?

Fields.DialogueText: Because the battle of Battenberg cake couldn't happen at a less convenient moment.
Aardvarks.
Wuff.
Heh... Work hard, Ark.
Maybe you will like it too, Captain. ... After the battle, I will send Miss Borges these recipes, I swear!
@BATTLE
Don't do this now.
But what's the point!?
Men, what's wrong?
Henry's refusing to go out and we got Morganas approaching us.
What seems to be the problem?
Ah, Henry here does not want to move out for some reason.
Is that so? Please speak your mind to me, Henry.
Hah... everyone has someone to fight for. Family, friends, whatever... But me? I got no one. I enlisted to have a roof over my head.
If I die out there, who would miss me? Why am I even going out there in the first place? To die to some zombie ship!?
At ease, Henry.
But--
Listen to me. Do you know what it is to be human? What your likes and dislikes are?
Well, yeah, but--
Then you still have something left to do on this planet, Henry. Not everyone in this war has someone to come back to, but they still go out to fight for all mankind.
Why? Because something inside of them knows that all men are brothers, all women are sisters. You fight for your family, the family of man. You know that is true deep inside your soul.
Ark Royal...
Go out there and fight for what is truly in your heart.
Yes, Lady!

Fields.MenuText: That was... beautifully said, Ark.
I couldn't have said it better myself.
I don't know what to say, Ark. Well done.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, it was nothing, Captain. When you're outside of someone's feelings, it is a bit easier to see the solution amid the confusion. Heh, that rhymed.
Ah, you are embarrassing me, Captain.
Heh, thank you, Captain.
Really, though, you are amazing, Ark. Whether you see that or not.
You're too kind, Captain. But we have Morganas to deal with. Shall we?
After you, Lady.
@BATTLE
Heh...
What's so funny?
Do you remember Leroy?
The leader of the underground Belle messaging system, right?
Well, one of the leaders. Anyway, the Englishman responded back to me recently.
Oh? How is he doing?
Ah... I can't tell you everything, but... he seems to be dealing with some demons of his own.
Demons?
At any rate, after I got this letter from Leroy, he slipped me a photograph.
Wait, is that--
Indeed. That is the Englishman playing hoop and stick, and what's more... look at his face.
Dear Lord.
He is smiling, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: He'd kill you if he knew about this!
Sell this on the market and you'll be rich, Ark!
I can't believe this.

Fields.DialogueText: What he doesn't know won't hurt him, Captain.
I am not that evil, Captain! I have my limits!
It's true, Captain. That is him in the flesh. And he's enjoying himself!
Heh, this makes me glad.
There's hope for all of us to get along, don't you think?
Yes... the Japanese... my own country... we have a chance to be at peace.
Mm. I'll do my best to ensure that.
Heh, thank you, Captain. Now to slip this in my--
What? Don't put the photo in there!
@BATTLE
The sirens are really loud today! Maybe I'm just noticing them  more than usual...
All right, on deck--!
Okay, now take a bite of the biscuit. Savor it. Then tell me what flavours...
Hm, I taste bits of star anise.
AAAAAAAAHHHHHH!
I don't think that is star anise. Tastes sort of like... an orange flavor.
Eh? You think so? Hm... maybe if you dip it in the Ceylon tea.
Oh heavens, my eyes!...
Royal, what the–
Aaah, Captain, join us. The Morganas are near, but we have time to do a little tasting.
You got the whole crew here? How!?
I informed them, of course! They set the tables up, got the tea warmer ready, and even baked some fresh biscuits!
Astounding, sailors!
Sweet mother of God, help me!

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe you're still doing this.
... Aren't you the least bit concerned of the screams?
I still don't understand how this is even remotely helpful to the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Why do you not believe? Please observe.
Of course I am. Wait a second.
Because I can do this...
Hah! I got you!
Oh, Lady! Thank you so much for saving me.
My pleasure.
Uh...
To hone your senses and to clarify your mind. That is the true purpose of drinking tea among battle. Have you not noticed our success rate has been higher since this meditation has happened?
Uh, I suppose...
If you want us to stay sharp, enjoy the tea for a moment.
Heh, all right. Ow!
Blow on the tea first, Captain...
@BATTLE
Hm... how peculiar.
Hm?
Lila Borges responded back to me but... I'm too frightened to open the envelope, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Shall we open it together?
Your hands are shaking. Are you that nervous?
Hm, the letter looks really bulky.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah... yes, please. Thank you, I will take care of the rest from here, Captain.
No, it is just the weight of the letter is getting to me. She's put at least twenty pages in here, and if they're as critical as the last... Let's see, now...
There are a lot more papers in it than before. Let's see what is inside...
What is it?
Lila... loved it.
Oh, that's great news, Ark!
No, that's not it. Look at this photograph.
A little girl and her family behind... tombstones?
They are holding up the pie and ice cream they have made together... I...
We'll read the rest of her letter in a bit. Let's worry about these Morganas first, all right?
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
Captain, are you free for a little while? I want to read the rest of that letter and see why that photo has the pie and ice cream.
Let me sign this... and that... Done. Let's see what this letter holds.
All right... Oh...

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong?
Did she put a secret criticism in there?
Ark?

Fields.DialogueText: Here... there is another page we didn't see before.
No... after the photo, she's...
Snfft... I am sorry...
She goes on to explain... she is the daughter of a gravedigger in Brazil.
Death is all around her. When they bury the dead, she can't feel anything at all about the one laid in the ground.
Lila is only... twelve years old. Over the years, she became desensitized to the meaning of death. When her own aunt died, she couldn't shed a tear. She says she couldn't feel anything at all.
But then... I sent her these recipes without even getting to know her. I took the time to respond back to her annoyances and cruelty to my recipes.
She felt genuine kindness from my letters and recipes, the time I took to get her to enjoy my work.

She said... she cried for the first time in 8 years. She realizes how precious the people around her are now. Now, she places a single rose over each grave her father digs and is determined to be a chef now.
That is...
Excuse me... I need...
Of course, Ark...
@BATTLE
Sniff...
Ark? There you are...
*crying*
Wha!? Why are you crying, Ark?

Lila... she cherishes me. I... touched her life. Everyone that sent me a letter, Joel... Lila... they were all so thankful for what I had done for them... They'll keep my recipes close to their heart.
I'm so happy... somewhere out there, I'll be remembered. I accomplished my dream.
I never published my recipes, but they'll be passed on.
I won't be forgotten, Captain!
Mm... you won't. By her, me, Joel, anyone. We'll all remember you. Somewhere out there, you saved a life with a recipe.
You think so?

Fields.MenuText: Yes.
You changed at least one life out of a thousand. There are bound to be others like her.
I know so, Ark.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you... Captain... for being my best friend... Thank you.
... Mm..You're right, Captain.
Heh, that confidence is what I like about you, Captain.
I can't wait to receive more letters from others!
They're going to come soon, I'm sure. Aaaand...
On cue, huh? Heh, some things never change.
